metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42961 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in wolfSSL before 5.5.0. A fault injection attack on RAM via Rowhammer leads to ECDSA key disclosure. Users performing signing operations with private ECC keys, such as in server-side TLS connections, might leak faulty ECC signatures. These signatures can be processed via an advanced technique for ECDSA key recovery. (In 5.5.0 and later, WOLFSSL_CHECK_SIG_FAULTS can be used to address the vulnerability.)

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
